p: Finally, the difference in bacterial-ecotype interaction was also mirrored to other microbes, as observed for the endomycorrhiza-ecotype interaction. The association of mycorrhiza with E. atherica is facultative [ 81]; hence, in waterlogged, very dry or saline soils colonization it is not favored due to low mycorrhizal inoculum potential [ 82, 83], explaining the low colonization in LE plants. However, even in low mycorrhizal colonization, mycorrhiza might increase E. atherica tolerance to higher soil sodium content in LE [ 84]. Moreover, high marsh sites can be dry during summer, and a high level of mycorrhizal colonization may improve water uptake in HE ecotype, such as in other salt marsh species [ 85].
